singlestore.manager.Cluster¶

class singlestore.manager.Cluster(name: str, cluster_id: str, region: singlestore.manager.Region, size: str, units: float, state: str, version: str, created_at: Union[str, datetime.datetime], expires_at: Optional[Union[str, datetime.datetime]] = None, firewall_ranges: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[str]] = None, terminated_at: Optional[Union[str, datetime.datetime]] = None, endpoint: Optional[str] = None)¶

SingleStore cluster definition.

This object is not instantiated directly. It is used in the results of API calls on the ClusterManager. Clusters are created using ClusterManager.create_cluster(), or existing clusters are accessed by either ClusterManager.clusters or by calling ClusterManager.get_cluster().

See also

ClusterManager.create_cluster(), ClusterManager.get_cluster(), ClusterManager.clusters

__init__(name: str, cluster_id: str, region: singlestore.manager.Region, size: str, units: float, state: str, version: str, created_at: Union[str, datetime.datetime], expires_at: Optional[Union[str, datetime.datetime]] = None, firewall_ranges: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[str]] = None, terminated_at: Optional[Union[str, datetime.datetime]] = None, endpoint: Optional[str] = None)¶

Use ClusterManager.clusters or ClusterManager.get_cluster().

Methods

__init__(name, cluster_id, region, size, ...)

Use ClusterManager.clusters or ClusterManager.get_cluster().

connect(**kwargs)

Create a connection to the database server for this cluster.

from_dict(obj, manager)

Construct a Cluster from a dictionary of values.

refresh()

Update the object to the current state.

resume([wait_on_resumed, wait_interval, ...])

Resume the cluster.

suspend([wait_on_suspended, wait_interval, ...])

Suspend the cluster.

terminate([wait_on_terminated, ...])

Terminate the cluster.

update([name, admin_password, expires_at, ...])

Update the cluster definition.

Attributes

name

Name of the cluster

id

Unique ID of the cluster

region

Region of the cluster (see Region)

size

Size of the cluster in cluster size notation (S-00, S-1, etc.)

units

Size of the cluster in units such as 0.25, 1.0, etc.

state

PendingCreation, Transitioning, Active, Terminated, Suspended, Resuming, Failed

version

Version of the SingleStore server

created_at

Timestamp of when the cluster was created

expires_at

Timestamp of when the cluster expires

firewall_ranges

List of allowed incoming IP addresses / ranges

terminated_at

Timestamp of when the cluster was terminated

endpoint

Hostname (or IP address) of the cluster database server
